definition: to rise vigorously/a spirited start
to exert oneself (bound form)

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group
to catch up vigorously/to set off in hot pursuit
Fenchihu, town in Chiayi County, Taiwan

sentences.english: There must be a specialty of large peas Fencihu.
sentences.chinese: 其中一定会有奋起湖的特产大碗豆。

sentences.english: Passengers had rebelled against the hijackers, who had turned the plane toward Washington.
sentences.chinese: 劫机者将飞机掉头飞往华盛顿，乘客们奋起反抗。

sentences.english: The entire nation raised up and drove the enemy soldiers out from their homeland.
sentences.chinese: 整个民族奋起反抗，把敌兵从国土上赶了出去。

sentences.english: Mum suggests that I should cheer up when meeting with setbacks.
sentences.chinese: 妈妈建议我在遇到挫折时应振奋起来。

sentences.english: At the critical moment, he plunged himself into the anti-Japanese war.
sentences.chinese: 在民族危机时刻他奋起投入了抗日救亡运动。

sentences.english: His friends' words inspired him to try again.
sentences.chinese: 他朋友的话使他振奋起来再试一次。

sentences.english: A catch-up is imminent, say the bulls.
sentences.chinese: 看涨者认为，股市不久将奋起直追。

sentences.english: May the road rise up to greet you, and the wind always be at your back.
sentences.chinese: 愿道路奋起欢迎你，愿风浪常在你身后。

sentences.english: The entire universe need not arm itself to crush him.
sentences.chinese: 整个天地不必奋起全力来将他剿杀。

sentences.english: Procrastination at the top during a crisis antagonized the board of directors.
sentences.chinese: 公司高管在危机中的延宕促使董事会奋起行动。

sentences.english: The entire country rose up and drove the Austrian soldiers from their homeland.
sentences.chinese: 全国人民奋起反抗，把奥军从他们的国土上驱逐出去。

sentences.english: Gather yourself together and begin to work.
sentences.chinese: 振奋起精神开始工作吧。

sentences.english: We shouldn't cower when confronted by evil forces, we should rise and fight them.
sentences.chinese: 对于邪恶势力我们不应重足而立，而是要奋起抗争。

sentences.english: Her friend's words inspired him to try again.
sentences.chinese: 她朋友的话使她振奋起来再试一次。

sentences.english: Do not sink, in any environment you can choose to rise.
sentences.chinese: 不要沉沦，在任何环境中你都可以选择奋起。

definition: dauntless/to summon up courage and determination/using extreme force of will
to do everything one can/to spare no effort/to strive
to go all out for sth at risk of one's life
to seize the opportunity/to strike while the iron is hot
to gather one's spirits/to pull oneself together
a cornered beast will still fight (idiom)/to fight like an animal at bay
to risk one's life
to straighten one's back
to take advantage of a favorable situation/to seize an opportunity
to exert oneself (bound form)
to flee/to go into exile (from prison)
to wait helplessly for death (idiom)/to resign oneself to extinction
anger against a common enemy (idiom); joined in opposition to the same adversary
in a spurt of energy
unyielding/indomitable
lit. to bite the teeth tightly (idiom); fig. to grit one's teeth and bear the pain/to bite the bullet
